thread.title: Olé! UKIP to host Spanish-themed New Year bash featuring Lembit Öpik
thread.title_full: Olé! UKIP to host Spanish-themed New Year bash featuring Lembit Öpik

author: Laura Hill
title: Olé! UKIP to host Spanish-themed New Year bash featuring Lembit Öpik
text:
Nigel Farage stands down as UKIP leader Share this video Watch Next 
Former MP and reality TV darling Lembit Öpik has been secured as the guest of honour. 
The Northern Irish-born son of an Estonian immigrant may seem like an unlikely choice, given his Liberal Democrat credentials. 
But the former Newcastle City Councillor is expected to be a popular addition to the event. 
Mr Elvin said: “I think it’s different, I just thought it would be nice to have him there. I know him quite well and he is prepared and happy to do it.” 
UKIP is gearing up for the by-election in Sandhill, Sunderland, after Labour representative Jacqui Gallagher lost her seat for failing to attend meetings for six months. Read More 
In a year that saw the city of Sunderland vote 61.3% in favour of leaving the EU, heralding Brexit, the party once again failed to secure a seat on Sunderland City Council. 
However, it came in second place in nine of the 12 seats it contested. 
Mr Elvin said he thinks the party will go from strength to strength in the region and is focusing on the local election in County Durham and Northumberland. Like us on Facebook
